GeneralInformation.History:
Ilia State University (ISU) is a flagship public research and comprehensive university in Georgia, located in its capital, Tbilisi. It was established in 2006 as a merger of six different institutions, each having a long history and a diverse institutional profile. Shortly afterwards it transformed itself into a multi-profile university with its significant research outputs visible at the national and international levels.
ISU’s four faculties - the Faculty of Arts and Sciences, the Faculty of Natural Sciences and Medicine, the Faculty of Business, Technology and Education, and the School of Law - offer a variety of unique academic programs, including joint and double degree programs in their respective disciplines. Along with 47 large and small-scale Research Institutes, Laboratories and Centers, Ilia State University creates in-depth research opportunities in Arts, Social Sciences, Education, Humanities, Business, Law, Medicine, Public Health, Life Sciences, Basic Sciences, Earth Sciences, Engineering and Architecture
AdmissionRequirements:
National: Unified National Exams
International: Secondary School Certificate, Subject Exams, Language Requirements, Interview

Address.university_name: Ivane javazishvilis sakhelobis tbilisis sakhelmts’ipo universit’et’i (TSU)

GeneralInformation.History: The first-ever national university in the Caucasus was founded and opened in Tbilisi in 1918 laying the foundation for a European-type higher school in Georgia, based on Georgian educational traditions. The idea of foundation of an university first emerged as far back as the early 19th century amid intensification of the struggle for liberation from Russian empire. The first-ever national University in the Caucasus was opened on 26 January 1918, the day of commemoration of King David the Builder (new style 8 February). Upon the nomination of Ivane Javakhishvili, the Council of Professors elected Petre Melikishvili as the first rector of the university. Ivane Javakhishvili took charge of the faculty of philosophy. Tbilisi State University is one of the largest higher educational institutions in the South Caucasus
AdmissionRequirements: Competitive entrance examination following general or special secondary school certificate

GeneralInformation.History: New Vision University is a civic, non-profit private institution founded in 2013. NVU mission is to expand human vision through promotion of education, research and innovation. The university inspires individuals to advance and share knowledge, skills and values to contribute to the well-being of the society. NVU is committed to social responsibility and promotes equal access to education to students from around the world. NVU is aspired to create open, innovative and collaborative environment to ensure student engagement and serve the society on a national and international scale
GeneralInformation.AcademicYear: September to June (Fall Semester: September - February; Spring Semester: February - June)
AdmissionRequirements:
- Bachelor programmes: School Leaving Certificate or equivalent
- Master programmes: Bachelor degree or equivalent (Bachelor degree in Law for Master’s program in Law)
- One-cycle programs (Medicine, Dentistry): School Leaving Certificate or equivalent
- PhD programmes: Master's degree (Master’s Degree in Law for PhD program in Law; MD for PhD in Medicine)
- Proof of proficiency in English at B2 Level for Bachelor’s and Master’s degree programs, including one-cycle programs of Medicine and Dentistry
In case of PhD programmes - C1 level, it can be any other European (German, French) language

240 David Aghmashenebeli Alley

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1919 as faculty of Tbilisi State University, became Georgian Agricultural Institute 1929, and acquired present status and title 1991

Founded 1933 as State Pedagogical Institute, Tbilisi. Acquired present status and title 2006 following merger of Kutiasi Akaki Tsereteli State University and Kutaisi N. Muskhelishvili State Technical University

Created 2002 as Tbilisis Ghia Universiteti (Tbilisi Open Teaching University) and first accredited in 2005. Acquired current title in 2021. A fully accredited institution with 20 years of experience in the Georgian educational sphere, with some 2,100 students from 17 countries. The University currently offers 12 academic programs, both undergraduate and graduate.
Its mission is to give students the full knowledge and all the skills they need to create added value in the long run, both for themselves and for the community in which they live.
Alte University's vision is to be one of the best educational institutions for quality education, scientific research, and professional skills development, both in the country and in the region, and to become a centre not only for Georgian students, but also for international students. Its values are:
Entrepreneurship
Innovation
Honesty
Striving for perfection
